intro: Homalobus miser, commonly known as the weeping bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its drooping, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Homalobus miser is native to parts of Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
